fields.description:
Project Leads and Project Admins see the re-indexing notification (as described in JRA-18080) while on the administration page of a project, but since they are not a JIRA System Administrator or JIRA Administrator, the message is useless and annoying because they do not have the correct permissions to perform the re-index.

Currently any user that has the Administration tab enabled and clickable, will see this message when they click on the tab.

However it should be that only the JIRA System Administrator or Administrators should see this message.
fields.summary: Re-indexing admin section notification should not be shown to any JIRA project admin
Put the Assignee field on the Version Tracking report

fields.description:
As discussed on EAC:

I like the "new look issue" in theory, but in practice it's made me less efficient on EACJ.  Most operations are grouped under the "More Options" menu and now require two mouse clicks instead of one.  There should be a per-user configuration to keep the classic UI.  That should doable by linking to different CSS, right?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20530].
  {panel}

JIRA at Gazprombank (Russia) is now in production usage (Version: 3.13.5-#360)

During the process of putting JIRA into production we made our own Russian localization of most interfaces visible to users (not administrators). 

We would like to see the same Russian localization (our variant) in next versions of JIRA.

Being new to JIRA support resources, first I created an issue on JIRA Support site: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-53231

The file language_ru_RU.jar (with our localization) is attached to issue JSP-53231.
I can attach it here as well (if needed).

Is it possible for you to include this Russian localization into the next version of JIRA?

Regards,
Roman Volynets
fields.summary: JIRA localization for Russian language

fields.description: While creating a bug in JIRA, user should not be able to select past date as a due date
fields.summary: While creating a bug in JIRA, user should not be able to select past date as a due date.

fields.description: Internally, JIRA tells OSWorkflow via a custom TypeResolver to use Pico container to instantiate classes for validators, conditions and post-functions. If the class requires plugin-exposed components to be injected into it (which are only available in Spring/OSGi and not Pico), then it cannot be instantiated by Pico and hence will not work.
fields.summary: Workflow plugin modules defined in V2 plugins will sometimes not work

fields.description:
The purpose of this need is to give the ability to ease the management of the global planning activities, such as maintenance versus release planning, or the ability to plan a Sprint targeting delivering issues assigned to a major and a maintenance release at the same time.

For instance, let's consider the following Version Types:
- Major Release
- Maintenance Release
- Sprint

We can than have the following Fix Versions and their respective types:
||FixVersion||Version Type|
|V3.0| Major Release |
|V3.1| Major Release |
|V2.12| Maintenance Release |
|V2.15| Maintenance Release |
|Sprint 4| Sprint |
|Sprint 5| Sprint |

As opposed to the Greenhopper plugin way of managing Releases dependencies, there is no parent-children relationship between these Fix Versions. For instance, it's not unrealistic to consider a given issue assigned at the SAME TIME to V2.12 for maintenance purposes, to V3.0 for back-porting reasons to the major release and to the Sprint 4 for the team planing purpose.

Having that is place, I clearly see multiple advantages:

1- The ability to filter by Release Type (All next maintenance releases content or current and next Sprints plans)

2- Given the first point, I would see a simple way to simplify the planning board right hand view given the ability to restrict the view selected release types only.

3- In the planning board again, the ability to reschedule issues between releases of the same type while keeping the other assignment unchanged: for instance changing the Maintenance Release of an issue doesn't change its Major release and its Sprint assignment.

Last but not least, it's an elegant way of solving GHS-945
fields.summary: Ability to support Version Typing
Display unlimited rows (more than 50 rows) in 2-dimensional gadgets

fields.description: Missing German translation in 2-dimensional gadget (see screenshot).
fields.summary: Missing German translations

fields.description:
Hi,

When JIRA (3.13.5-#360) had been put into production at Gazprombank, the requirement of JIRA administrators and information security administrators was that Project Administrators should not be able to change project role membership. 

According to the approach used at Gazprombank any changes to user rights and permissions (in case of JIRA, project role membership) are performed only by administrators who act according to applications confirmed by information security administrators.

So we were forced to customize JIRA functionality in this part.

Namely, we replaced DefaultProjectRoleService.class (\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\jira\bc\projectroles) with a changed class (the modifications include calls to hasAdminPermission(currentUser) function):

1) method removeActorsFromProjectRole

if (hasProjectRolePermission(currentUser, project) && hasAdminPermission(currentUser) )

2) method updateActorsToProjectRole

if (!internalError && hasProjectRolePermission(currentUser, ProjectRoleProject ) && hasAdminPermission(currentUser) && actors.size() > 0)
...
else if (!hasProjectRolePermission(currentUser, projectRoleProject) || !hasAdminPermission(currentUser) )

We needed a quick way to do that so we acted like this (sorry!).

However, our suggestion for future versions of JIRA is to divide Administer Projects permission into two separate permissions:

1) Administer Projects (ability to edit project components, project versions, and some project details ('Project Name', 'URL', 'Project Lead', 'Project 
Description'));

2) Administer Project Role Membership (to edit project role membership).

Please, consider this suggestion to be implemented in JIRA.

Regards,
Roman Volynets
fields.summary: Permission to edit project role membership

fields.description: It would be great to give (some) users the ability to stop JIRA from sending email alerts out when they only make a minor change to an issue on the Edit screen.  This would be very similar to the 'Minor change' feature in Confluence and the "Send mail for this update" option JIRA gives when doing bulk changes.

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a Jira application installed on an Unix Server and Weblogic 10.3. Everything is working fine.

But when I export the variable LANG with the value *fr_FR.iso88591*, in order to have the correct french numerical format display, it's working. However, when I hit F5 to refresh the Jira web page, the latter displays badly. Please see in attachment, the bad display. 
If I hit F5 again, everything is going back to normal. Also, attachment provided.

This problem doesn't occur on a standalone version of Jira with Tomcat, and the LANG variable also set to fr_FR.iso88591.

Do you please have any advice to continue using the locale language settings without the F5 display problem?

Thanks a lot for your input.
fields.summary: Bad display of Jira web page when hit F5 refresh key

Rank field needs to editable and non mandatory. This will save our lots of time.
May be this can be done for specific project , I can supply the list.

Currently a version can have one of the three stati in JIRA:
- Open
- Released
- Archived

It would be great to have an additional status available named "defect".
This version should be used in order to reject a already released version (e.g. because critical errors have beend found). Currently it is only possible to unrelease a version, but then it appears on the planning-board again.

fields.description:
A couple of improvements:

1. The document says:

bq. email notifications will continue to be sent to the user — If this is a problem, you can change the user's email address in JIRA to an imaginary address, e.g. user@example.com.

email notifications will only be sent to users with browse permission over the project/issue that is generating the notification. In most of the cases, that means that by removing the user form all the groups, they will stop receiving notifications.

On the other hand, filter subscription continue to be sent unless the email is changed.

2. The warning note says:

bq. Before you deactivate a user, you should reassign any issues assigned to that user. You'll need the 'Assign Issue' permission to change the assignee for the issues.

We should add another point saying that they should check that the user is not the default assigneee for a project. If the default assignee of a project does not have 'assignable' project permissions, it can create certain problems within Jira.
fields.summary: Improvement in "deactivate user' documentation

fields.description:
Our default email format is set to HTML and our notification scheme also notifies a Single Email Address (to a distribution email alias, my.group.of.users@example.com).

For example, a change notification will go to actual Jira users as well as the Single Email Address. The notification to a Jira user arrives as HTML format, but the same notification that goes to the Single Email Address arrives as plain text.

We want the email that goes to the Single Email Address to be sent as HTML as well.

Why does the notification that go to an email address get sent as plain text instead of the nicely formatted HTML version?
fields.summary: Email notification to a non-Jira user appears as plain text instead of HTML

fields.description:
A search for a shared filter including the word "team" doesn't return the complete set of results. 
It turns out that the filters were created with an initial name and then renamed to start with "Team". I think the search isn't looking at the current name, but it's looking at the initial name that it was created with. 

The filters are definitely shared, because if I do a search with an empty search field, the "Team" filters appear in the results.
fields.summary: Searches on saved filters don't return results if the filter has been renamed

fields.description:
Hi,

In jira-application.properties, it say that Hyphens should be excluded in Project Key Pattern.
{noformat}
# Project Key Pattern
# Specify the perl5 regexp for defining the project key - this regex will be prepended with "^" and closed with "$" for an exact matching rule.
# Note that the project key must only be allowed to contain ASCII characters, as it is used in HTTP GET requests.  This means that
# you should not allow slashes (/) in your project keys, as they will make it impossible for JIRA to distinguish between
# project keys and unrelated URL parts.  See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12819.  Hyphens should also be excluded.  See http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-13910 for more information.
#
# Also specify the warning and description that will be displayed to inform the user how the project key should be formed.
#
# If you wish to have alphaNumeric project keys, use the pattern:  ([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)
jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z][A-Z]+)


{noformat}

However, our example at [Configuring Project Keys|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Project+Keys] show the example using hyphen as shown in the screenshot below:
!Screenshot.png!

This two documentations contradict each other and actually, Hyphens should not be used in the Project Key.

Cheers,
Janet
fields.summary: Configuring Project Key with Hyphen

fields.description:
When using the Calendar plugin and an issue filter to display issues on the calendar, versions from all projects are displayed on the calendar. 

If I have two projects and use a filter to display issues from one project on the calendar. I get version information from any project in JIRA, rather than just a single project used in the filter. This only happens when using the saved filters. If I select a single project it works correctly and the calendar only displays issues from a single project not all in the instance.
I'm listing this as a major loss of function as the customer noted that if you have a larger instance that makes strong use of version information then the Calendar becomes useless as it is so cluttered with information from projects that don't apply.

Original support case is https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-51818

*Steps to Reproduce*

1. In JIRA 4.0.1 install the Calendar Plugin.
2. Create 2 or more projects, the more the better
3. Add several issues to each project 5-10
4. Create 2 or more versions in each project
5. Create a saved filter that shows issues from a single project
6. Add a JIRA Calendar Gadget to the dashboard
7. Configure the gadget to display issues from your saved filter.

*Expected Result*
Calendar Should ONly display issues/versions related to the saved filter.

*What Happens*
Calendar shows version information from all projects in the instance.
fields.summary: Calendar plugin displays shows versions across all projects even when using a single project filter to display issues

fields.description:

We need to consider, existing contexts, existing JVM variables, existing Datasource (or direct JDBC), etc, etc

We should also edit 

[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+JIRA]

to point to the doc to migrate.
fields.summary: We need docs for migrating from WAS/Weblogic/JBoss to Tomcat

fields.description:
As a former PVCS Tracker user there is one thing that I miss, dependent field relations. For instance:

The parent field is backend type and the other field is backend version (some of our products can communicate with different backends). If I select backend type A, version 1.0, 1.1 and 2.0 are availible. When I select backend B version 4.0 and 4.6 are available.

Ofcourse you can use a selection field or a free text field, but in my opinion this is better for creating reports and force users to make a good choice.

An other posbility is creating different fields for eacht backend, but that will increase the coice possibilty for the user and making more mistakes.
fields.summary: Dependent field relations

fields.description:
Our Jira implementation is not public to our customers by default. But if there is a bug reported you want to relate it to a customer. We have serveral hundreds of customers and a couple of dozen products that can be related to a customer. If we want to relate it at the moment, we have to create a selection field or a free input field. The first one is very labour intensive for the admins and the second one is not very useful when you are creating reports (users tend to discribe things differently form each other)

We do have a CRM suite that registers the customer and the product that they apply for. What you can do is make a view and export that data, which you can import once a while in a aux table in Jira for instance. Ofcourse there also must be a posibilty to relate that aux data to a certain project.
fields.summary: Auxiliary tables for customer data (etc)

fields.description:
Cannot see full text fields when using the print or print preview mode in Excel after exporting to Excel from the Jira Issue Navigator using the "Current Fields" option.

The text field elements are being truncated when using the print preview / print mode. Even at 100% before reducing down to 80% to fit page width. I am not an advanced Excel user... but having the "& Char(10)" hard line-break at the end of the text string may solve the problem?
fields.summary: Cannot see full text fields when using the print or print preview mode in Excel after exporting to Excel from the Jira Issue Navigator using the "Current Fields" option.

fields.description:
Early january, we upgraded the Jira version we were using to Jira 3.13.5.
Since that upgrade, we face problems with report "Created VS Resolved issues". Only resolved issued that have been modified at least once since the day of the upgrade are considered in regard of the construction of this report. All other previous issues, either resolved or closed, and who have not been modified since january are not taken into account, which, obviously, results in entirely false report.
Since these reports are used with some of our major bank's customers establishments, this bug has some real consequences for our relationship with our customers.
We considered about to massively reopen all those issues, and close them again, so that the account woult take them, but this is not a suitable solution for us, since we must display at what time the issue was solved. To massively reopen/close issues would result in an abrupt raise of resolved issue in the report "Created VS Resolved issues". We need the report to correctly account all the issues, not only those modified since january.
fields.summary: Bug reporting on portlet "Created VS Resolved Issues"
Option "Printable" for dashboards same as similar option for "Issue Navigator"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20470].
  {panel}

Hello,

The only thing that i did not much like in JIRA 4 is the new dashboard selector column. Usually people just have a few dashboards and thus there is just white space below the selection links. This white spaces scrambles the layout of the portlets on the right compared to the layout in JIRA3 where the portlets had more space on the screen. 

For this reason there should be some way to switch to a horizontal dashboard selector or a popup selector that that preserves the layout of portlets. This would increase acceptance of JIRA 4 in our organization.

Best regards
Dieter
fields.summary: Let user switch between horizontal and vertical dashboard selection links

fields.description:
Hello,
I'm new here, but I have worked with Jira for some time now, so have at least a basic idea about how it works etc.

We aren't done with our software yet, so the "release comments"-matter wasn't that important yet, but soon we will be ready and so I'm looking into the templates for release comments at the moment.
Because of this I was able to deal with that matter recently and I have to agree with many users, which posted here: Jira's release notes templates are somewhat out of date and compared to the really great piece of software (Jira itself), their inelasticity and inflexibility are very untypical.

Ok, there are quides how to customize the templates, but that's not an easy task, especially not for people like me, who don't have an idea about java programming etc.
Issue navigator -> saved filters doesn't meat all the requirements users might have or do have.

I also would like to see some changes here in the feature.

For our case I was thinking about something like this:

- defining of the title for the release notes: "Release notes for the version <current_version>"
- defining of the group type: at the moment it's "issueType.name" (Bug, New Feature, ...). We would rahter like to use "resolution.name" (Fixed, Added, ...), since that is the part, which is important to the customer, not the title of the issue, which was entered while creating. Many different issueType.names can lead to a single resolution.name (Bug, To Clarify, Question -> Fixed etc.)
- defining of issue-Types and resolution-types, which shall be considered by the creation of release notes instead of taking all of the issues for the current version or to edit the templates all the time
- defining / formatting of the fields, which shall be used and visible for each entry (issue.key, resolution.note (should be available by default and be a "must fill in"-field instead of creating a selfdefined field), issue.summary, resolution.date, ...)
- storing of different templates and the ability to choose one them before generation (one should be defined as default). For example: that way it would be possible to easily generate public release notes for customers and then private release notes with inetrnal entries and comments etc.

So basically some some text and structure templates with some variables / place holders and storage / selection of several templates defined that way.

More or less the same, what users are asking about on the forums many times.

That would make Jira much more enjoyable than it is already.

Regards,
Mark
fields.summary: Improve the usability and flexibility of release notes generation / customization

fields.description:
Hi,

{quote}
'Email me when I make changes' (i.e. whether you wish to receive email notifications about issue updates that you have made, or only about issue updates made by other people).
{quote}
This lines can be found at [Managing Your User Profile|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+your+User+Profile] and the explanation is wrong.

Actually, JIRA will not send any notification when "Email me when I make changes" is unchecked even though the "Notify users of their own changes?" via Administration > User Defaults is "YES".

Cheers,
Janet
fields.summary: Email me when I make changes in explaination
Allow comments in JQL strings

fields.description:
When a user sends us an email with attachment from a certain email system (that I don't have control over), the mailhandler creates an issue (as it is supposed to), but if there are any attachments, they are lost.

We get this one in the log when such an email arrives:

2010-02-01 12:40:10,679 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 WARN [com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils] Unable to extract text from MIME part with Content-Type 'multipart/mixed;
	boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01CAA333.314BAB2B"
2010-02-01 12:40:10,679 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 WARN [com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils] Unable to extract text from MIME part with Content-Type 'application/ms-tnef;
	name="winmail.dat"

I have spoken with the guy in charge of the customer's mailsystem, where the mail lands before it is being forwarded to the jira mail POP boxes. When they receive the email, they apparently encode it in TNEF and forwards it to a internal domain where it is relayed to the Jira mail SMTP->POP boxes. Exchange 2003 does not support re-formatting the email to a different format when it forwards emails. My guess is, that sometime back in the days, Exchange for some reason was set to TNEF for this specific customer and HTML for our other customers. BUT, this is a production system in the banking world, so people are very reluctant to change anything that is in production and running unless one can prove the change will not break anything else in the systems. Which I can't. Roadblock.

So for now, the only option is to get Jira to eat TNEF encoded emails. Perhaps some kind of preprocesser that is initiated by the mail handler before it actually tries to parse the email?
fields.summary: TNEF encoded email handler

fields.description:
Reported by https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-52689

The two dimensional filter statistics gadgets always have a horizontal scroll bar in Chrome. This is the case even when it is not needed.
fields.summary: Scroll bars on 2 Dimensional filter Statistics  always there in Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 22-11-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, we have reviewed this bug report recently and realized that this bug request was created before it was explicitly indicated that NFS are not supported in Jira, and also that Jira 4 (the version where this bug was reported) reached End of Life quite some time ago, so this bug ticket is no longer valid, and we will proceed to close it.

If there are is any feedback for the support of NFS in Jira, please see the feature request JRASERVER-33887 Implement JIRA Lucene Index NFS Support where the interest for this is being gathered.

Thanks,
René Chiquete - Atlassian Support.
{panel}
To facilitate access to attachments in JIRA by the deployment team, a LUN was shared from the NetApp SAN as NFS to the JIRA host and as CIFS to the Windows hosts. NetApp also has a number of facilities that better allow the management of files in backups to provide mminimum downtime on the server as well as the minimal amount of space used for backups.

The mount was successful on both the Linux and the Windows systems. We were able to copy files from the local filesystems on the Linux host to the NFS mount and read them from Windows.

The JIRA attachments directory was changed to use the NFS mount. JIRA failed to create the attachment with a permission denied error. We tried a different locally-mountd attachments directory which worked fine.

We were able to resolve this by using a CIFS mount of the same LUN. This is not ideal as smbmount is generally considered to be less secure on Linux than is NFS. We would like to have this addressed so that we can use properly use NFS in the future.
fields.summary: JIRA attachments can not be stored on a NFS mount

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this issue is duplication of JRA-19379, but because it is marked as closed and fixed and I still have the problem I've decided to open a new one here. Below is the exception I'm getting trying to start jira standalone on IBM AIX with the IBM JDK 1.6.0 Sr6 (full version info provided at the end of the stack trace). If this is an IBM issue I'll highly appreciate if someone could point me to IBM's PMR# to be able to track the progress there. Or do I need specific IBM JRE version to be able to run jira?

TIA,
Ilko

fields.description:
This issue is created from:
* https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-52254

The Time Since Issue Report does not work with Date Custom Field. This can be reproduce from https://support.atlassian.com or http://jira.atlassian.com.

Steps to reproduce in https://support.atlassian.com:

# Goto Projects > JIRA Support (JSP) > Reports > Time Since Issues Report
# Select the criteria as below: {noformat}
Project or Saved Filter: JIRA Support
Date Field: Date of First Response
Period: Daily
Days Previously: 30
Cumulative Totals?: Yes
{noformat}
# No report will be shown here
|
fields.summary: Time Since Issue Report does not work with Date Custom Field

fields.description:
Currently, all comments added by the create or comment mail handler (for example) are visible to all users who have permission to view the issue.  Tools like the [JIRA Extendable Mail Handler|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JEMH/JIRA+Extendable+Mail+Handler] provide the ability to specify who can view the comments that are created.  

It would be useful to provide a supported option to do the same.
fields.summary: Add the ability to control the visibility of comments created using the built-in mail handlers

fields.description:
We have rather complex dashboards, up to 20 gadgets. With Jira 3.0 this loaded rather quickly. However after upgrading to 4.0.1 we found that the front page takes a long time to load. It appears that the cause is the AJAX rendering, and also the way that AJAX sends separate HTML requests for all the individual gadgets. This overhead causes the page to take excessive time to load.

We don't really use the AJAX features that much. The ability to re-arrange the gadgets with click and drag is nice, but you only need to do that once and after that you don't touch it much. These small features doesn't seem to be worth the extra long loading time.

On firefox, the loading time can be up to 16 seconds before the Dashboard is fully loaded.

It would be nice to have an option to disabled the AJAX features and go back to the static dashboard of Jira 3.0
fields.summary: An option for a non-ajax dashboard

fields.description: We have about 20 Gadgets on the dashboard (mostly search filter results), and when you right click on a link it can take 15-60 seconds before the menu comes up. It appears that the more gadgets you have, the longer it takes to respond.
fields.summary: Right clicking on dashboard links when there are a lot of gadgets is super slow.

fields.description:
h1. Symptoms

When running JIRA on Windows and selecting Turkish as OS regional format, JIRA can't save some Gadget configurations change (e.g. filter id, project id). 

When saving the configuration of 'Filter Results' Gadget, the 'filterId' is passed as '' in backend Insert SQL and saved blank in gadgetuserpreference table at DB side.  SQL logging shows entries like the following in the logs:

{noformat}
INSERT INTO dbo.gadgetuserpreference (ID, PORTLETCONFIGURATION, USERPREFKEY, USERPREFVALUE) VALUES ('10523', '10051', 'filterId', '')
{noformat}

When accessing a dashboard after it's saved, messages like the following will appear in the logs: 

{noformat}
[atlassian.jira.dashboard.JiraDashboardStateStoreManager] Stored state for dashboard with id '10051' is not the same as in memory state.  Trying to rewrite the entire state...
{noformat}


h1. Steps to Reproduce

1. shutdown JIRA instance
2. Go to Windows Console Panel, open 'Regional and Language Options', change Regional Format to 'Turkish'
3. reboot JIRA instance
4. Go to an own Dashboard, click 'Add Gadget' and add 'Filter Results' Gadget
5. In Dashboard, select filter for new added Gadget and save it, then get the filter results correctly displaying in new created Gadget
6. Move to another page, e.g. click on 'Projects'
7. Come back Dashboard page again, then find the just created 'Filter Results' Gadget needs to be re-configured

h1. Workaround

Change the java user language settings to use US English instead of Turkish.

h2. Under Linux/UNIX/OS X

Edit your setenv.sh file and add the following options to your JAVA_OPTS setting: {code}-Duser.language=en
 -Duser.region=US{code}

h2.  When Running under Windows as a Service

# Find the Tomcat service ID for your JIRA instance by right-clicking the service name in the Services control panel.  You will see a string like:  {code}c:/path/to/tomcat/bin/tomcat5.exe //RS//ABC123412341{code}  You can actually copy the whole string (which we didn't do).
# Paste the string into notepad or another tool
# Change the //RS// to //US//
# Add the following to the end of the command: {code}++JvmOptions="-Duser.language=en -Duser.region=US"{code}
# Open a command shell
# Navigate to the binary directory for your tomcat installation
# Run the command you've created
# Restart the JIRA service

h2. When Running under Windows (but Not as a Service)
Edit your setenv.bat file and add the following options to your JAVA_OPTS setting: {code}-Duser.language=en
 -Duser.region=US{code}
fields.summary: Some Gadget configurations can't be saved when running JIRA and selecting Turkish as region format

fields.description: The legacy bridge still makes loopback requests to JIRA even after the loopback fix (JRA-19217). This is because the legacy-bridge is not a regular gadget and actually makes a rest call to get the gadget spec.
fields.summary: The Legacy Gadget bridge still makes loopback request

fields.description:
In the list of items:

>> People who have the 'JIRA Administrators' permission (and not the 'JIRA System Administrators' permission) cannot do the following:

We should add a line for adding gadgets to the gadget repository, since only System Administrators can do that.
fields.summary: Only System Administrators can add gadgets to the directory

fields.description:
At some point between Jira 3.23 and Jira 4.0.1 logic was added in AbstractMessageHandler.java that prevents Jira from processing emails that Jira generated itself.  I understand this was done to eliminate a customer's ability to configure things in a way that would cause a loop where Jira creates an email that generates a comment which generates another email and so on until someone stops it.

The business/Jira processes we have in place rely on Jira being able to process its own messages and the upgrade from 3 to 4.0.1 broke parts of our processes.  We understand the risks associated with the Jira 3 behavior and while we appreciate Jira becoming more idiot-proof, we need the Jira 3 functionality.

The only short term workaround we've been offered so far (in JSP-52456) is for us to comment out a section of the code in AbstractMessageHandler.java and then build, install and test the new jar.  We are hesitant to do this for a few reasons:

* it sounds like it will leave us in unsupported territory if we run into any new problems after making this change
* those changes would likely be lost in our next Jira code update
* we don't have any Java resources in house to manage this

There are two things we'd like from Atlassian.

Short term: We would like Atlasian to provide a new jar file or whatever the appropriate thing would be that we could drop in place that would have the section of code referenced in JSP-52456 commented out. 

Long term: We would like Jira to have a configuration option available that will allow us to have the Jira 3 behavior, enabling Jira to process its own mail.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Change to mail handling in AbstractMessageHandler.java breaks Jira-3 behavior we need

fields.description: If you filter on "component != foo", it only finds issues with a different component set, but excludes issues where the component field is unset entirely.
fields.summary: Filtering on "component != foo" excludes issues with no component set

fields.description:
1. Create a new bug, and assign a version to it. Then browse the project.
2. Edit the bug and change the description.
3. Browse the project

Result:
R1. This item (bug) has a strike-through line when you browse the project.

4. Go to the Project > Versions > Manage versions > Click on the bug's version

Result:
R2: The bug is considered as "resolved" although it is unresolved / open (see it the attached screen-shot)
fields.summary: Edit an item changes the item's definition to "resolved" in two aspects, but not as a "status"
Task Q2

fields.description:
Invalid dates in time tracking are parsed (wrong) without notification.

Enter 160/Feb/10 11:44 AM in the work log start date input. It will be parsed as 10/Jul/10 11:44 AM.
fields.summary: Dates are parsed wrong in work log input page

fields.description: There is a noticible delay when Left or Right Clicking links on a Dashboard with ~30 gadgets. In 4.1 there was a huge improvement over 4.0.x (see JRA-20428) however more work still needs to be done.
fields.summary: There is a noticible delay when Left or Right Clicking on a Dashboard with ~30 gadgets.

fields.description: Left or Right Clicking on a Dashboard with ~30 gadgets causes Firefox to issue a slow script warning. Essentially you can't click links. This make such a dashboard impossible to use.
fields.summary: Left or Right Clicking on a Dashboard with ~30 gadgets causes Firefox to issue slow script warning.

fields.description: Based on https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-52593 it's impossible to define at workflow level how assignee was selected (by user or assigned automatically). It will be nice to know for automating sub-task creating procedure (see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-6398?focusedCommentId=185004&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#action_185004 as well).
fields.summary: Allow at workflow validation/post-function define if assignee was selected by user or assign automatically

fields.description: When you release a version, JIRA automatically sends update emails for every single UNRESOLVED issue in that Fix Version. Sometimes this results in huge amounts of bulk emails sent to our developers. We'd like the option to NOT send those update emails when marking a version "released", just like the checkbox at the bottom of the Bulk Change screen.
fields.summary: When releasing a version, add a checkbox for "send email" like Bulk Change has

fields.description:
If a JIRA plugin defines an issue operation that is displayed in the Issue Details screen, the operation does not appear in the drop-down list of operations in the Issue Navigator.

Issue Navigator should offer the call to all operations available to the issue, even those defined by plugins.
fields.summary: Custom Issue operations do not appear in navigator

fields.description:
When JIRA is unable to load a Listener, it simply ignores it. This makes it impossible to delete a broken listener from the UI. The user must either fix the problem or delete the listener manually from the database.

One way for a listener to stop loading correctly would be to disable and/or remove a plugin. In this case to delete a listener would require the user to re-enable to plugin delete the listener and then disable the plugin again.
fields.summary: It is not possible to delete a JIRA listener that does not load correctly.
The Service logging at startup prints "java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: This method is not supported in an UnloadableJiraServiceContainer" for broken services.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Start JIRA with a 2.0 plugin with a service.
# Add the service from the plugin.
# Disable the plugin.
# Restart JIRA.
# JIRA will restart but with the service disabled (if JRA-20419 has been fixed)
# Now try and add another instance of the service from the plugin. You should get an UnsupportedOperationException.

While it is an error to create a service that does not load we should be giving an error message rather than an UOE.
fields.summary: An "OperationNotSupported" can be thrown when trying to create a bad service

fields.description:
JIRA does not react well when a RuntimeException is thrown during Service initialization. It does two things:
# Does not load any of the services from the database.  
# Creates some services (like mail) because it believes there are none in the database. This leads to duplicate services in the database.
fields.summary: A Runtime Exception in Service Initialisation will stop all services from loading

fields.description:
Confluence's English language pack is named "en_GB", while JIRA's is named "en_UK".
When the JIRA Activity Stream gadget is embedded into Confluence, it displays an error because it is looking for an "en_GB" language pack in JIRA, which does not exist.

"The resource http://penny:8080/s/472/1/2/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin:date-en-GB/date-en-GB.js, cannot be found."

There are three issues here:
1) JIRA and Confluence are not consistent in their naming of their English language packs.
2) UK is not a valid country code. According to ISO 3166, the correct country code for United Kingdom is GB. http://www.iso.org/iso/english_country_names_and_code_elements
3) The Activity Stream gadget does not fall back to the default language when a matching language pack is not found. This may impact people who write their own translations of JIRA.
fields.summary: JIRA Activity Stream gadget displays error in Confluence due to en_GB / en_UK mismatch
Upgrade Velocity from 1.4.x to 1.6.x

fields.description:
Creating filter search, provide feature to subscribe it.
But have only one account, you could subscribe only for email that defined in account preferences.

Asking feature to add choice in subscription email, or define email manually.
As for different filters could be assigned different peoples that responsibility for these tasks.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Filter subscription for another emails
